Package au.edu.anu.qgraph

package au.edu.anu.qgraph

qgraph defines a graph querying system to use with omugi.

This package defines one ancestor interface, Queryable, and many implementations of it. Queryable descendants (we call them queries) can be used (1) to check that elements of a graph verify some condition or (2) to collect parts of the graph according to some conditions. Queries can be chained so that elaborate searches can be performed on a Graph. This library actually defines a language to travel a graph, pick information, get elements based on some conditions, etc.

Of course the list of queries can be freely expanded ad infinitum by writing implementations of Queryable.

List of queries currently available

query function applies to
AndQuery check if all its sub-queries are satisfied Object
OrQuery check if at least one of its sub-queries are satisfied Object
NotQuery check if none of its sub-queries are satisfied Object
XorQuery check if exactly one of its sub-queries are satisfied Object
CountQuery check that an integer ('count') is within a range Integer
SizeQuery check that the size of an object is within a specified range Sizeable
SelectQuery select objects of a collection according to a multiplicity, optionally using a query Collection< Object>
SequenceQuery select objects that satisfy a series of queries chained after the other, starting on a single object Object
IsQuery check that an object is a query Queryable
ForAllQuery apply a query on a collection of objects Iterable< Object>
IfThenQuery test query. If satisfied, apply a query to the argument, if not, apply another one Object
IsClass check that a class object is of a given class Class
IsInstanceOf check that an object is of a given class Object
Value return its argument as a result Object
IsBoolean check if an object is a boolean Object
IsDate check if an object is a Date or if it is within a given date range Object
IsDouble check if an object is a double or if it is within a given range Object
IsFloat check if an object is a float or if it is within a given range Object
IsInteger check if an object is an int or if it is within a given range Object
IsLong check if an object is a long or if it is within a given range Object
IsString check if an object is a String or if its length is within a given range Object
IsIntegerRange check if an object is an IntegerRange Object
StringLength get the length of a String String
StartsWith check that a String starts with a given String String
ElementLabel check that a graph element matches one of a serie of class identifiers/labels Specialized
ElementName check that a graph element matches one of a serie of identifiers/names Identity
ElementProperty check that a graph element has a given property and optionally a value for this property ReadOnlyPropertyList, ReadOnlyDataHolder,
NodeEdges select graph edges linked to a node Node
NodeListEdges select IN, OUT or all edges of a list of Nodes Iterable< Node>
TreeQuery select parts of a tree starting at some node TreeNode
EdgeNodes select start, end, other-end or both-ends nodes of an edge Edge
EdgeListNodes select start, end, other-end or both-ends nodes of a list of edges Iterable< Edge>

Static methods in the CoreQueries class implement the most common use cases of queries for a graph.

Author:
Jacques Gignoux - 13 sept. 2021
